title: Could a giant squid eat a human being? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, the squids are carnivorous, and maybe can bite a human as accidental event. But human beings are not their habitual food. The habitat of the giant squid is too deep for a human being and they dont used to swim towards the surface of the sea. And human beings, if get that depths must do it in a submarine, that protect them of any harm. Therefore is quite eventually possible that kind of accidents. It could happen if when a squid is trapped and left on the deck of a ship, and a foolish and reckless human put its hand, near the beak on the mouth of the squid and got bitten. There are always somebody as foolish to do it .

In theory they could, but it’s really unlikely ever to happen. Giant squid (Architeuthis) live in the deep ocean, and never come to the surface unless sick. Even with specialist deep-diving scuba gear no human is ever going to get down into giant squid habitat (and no giant squid is ever going to break into a submersible), while any giant squid coming up into the depths a human might swim in will be too ill to attack anyone.

Humans are not normally on their menu. However, many marine creatures Are feeders of opportunity. A Humboldt squid, or squids can be very dangerous, and could cause serious or fatal wounds. About the only time a Giant Squid would have an opportunity to feed on a human, would be after a deceased human sunk several thousand feet in the ocean. Even then, there are too many scavengers about to leave anything left for a squid.

Yes. The Humboldt squid has killed and eaten people, and that’s about the size of a human. The giant squid is more four times the size. If a human diver is still alive and swimming in the deep ocean in the same area as an Architeuthis, I don’t see why the squid wouldn’t view us as an appetizer to be best served with marinara.

Yep. It would eat us if it has the chance. However, it depends on the size of the squid. If it’s 10–11 meters, it could kill you and eat you if your not in your submarine. But a 15–20 meter long Giant Squid would no doubt attack a submarine if it has the chance though.

They can if they get the chance and are hungry enough, but I doubt that we are their favorite.They eat fish, crustaceans (like shrimp), crabs and even other squids They are able to catch prey with their two feeding tentacles, then hold the prey with their eight arms and bite it into small pieces using a parrot-like beak. I would recommend avoiding and large squids, if possible.
